intro: Anaphalis morii, commonly known as the silver hair grass, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its fluffy, white, hair-like flowers that resemble a cloud. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine, silver-colored hairs. Anaphalis morii is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
